item.title: Coronavirus: WHO reports record single-day global increase in cases
item.description: The number of new cases has surpassed 250,000 in a day, the World Health Organization says.

item.title: Coronavirus: Boris Johnson 'does not want second national lockdown'
item.description: Having the option of a nationwide shutdown is like a "nuclear deterrent", the prime minister says.

item.title: Russia's UK ambassador rejects coronavirus vaccine hacking allegations
item.description: Russia's representative in the UK also dismisses suggestions of interference in British politics.

item.title: Coronavirus: Are mutations making it more infectious?
item.description: While there have been thousands of changes to the virus only one is seen as possibly altering its behaviour.

item.title: Princess Beatrice and Edoardo Mapelli Mozzi release wedding photos
item.description: Buckingham Palace shares the images after she married property tycoon Edoardo Mapelli Mozzi on Friday.

item.title: Portland protests: Oregon state files lawsuit against federal US government
item.description: The state attorney general accuses the federal government of violating citizens' rights in protests.

item.title: Mark Drakeford 'will not serve whole Senedd term'
item.description: The first minister says it will "be time for somebody else to have a chance to do this job".

item.title: Changing Places toilets for disabled people to be compulsory
item.description: Campaigners say rules for Changing Places toilets in new buildings are "nothing short of life changing".

item.title: Sheikh Sabah al-Ahmad al-Sabah: Kuwaiti emir hospitalised for medical checks
item.description: The crown prince will 'temporarily' take over some of Sheikh Sabah al-Ahmad al-Sabah's duties.

item.title: Ekaterina Alexandrovskaya, Australia Olympics skater, dies in Moscow at 20
item.description: Russian-born Ekaterina Alexandrovskaya competed for Australia at the 2018 Winter Olympics.

item.title: Suffolk Punch horse born using sex-sorted sperm technology
item.description: The filly is the first in the UK to be born using sex-sorted sperm to determine its gender.

item.title: Arsenal 2-0 Man City: Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang guides Gunners into FA Cup final
item.description: Arsenal manager Mikel Arteta outmanoeuvres his mentor Pep Guardiola as the Gunners reach the FA Cup final with victory at Wembley.

item.title: The Papers: 'No national lockdown' and 'missing' Prince Andrew
item.description: Many of Sunday's front pages feature the official royal wedding photos, with Prince Andrew absent.

item.title: The woman forced to flee her country for rapping.
item.description: Iranian rapper Justina tells her story from exile after facing jail in her country, where women are banned from singing solo.

item.title: Coronavirus: 'When coffins lined the streets of my hometown'
item.description: Ecuadorean journalist Blanca Moncada was on the front line of the Covid-19 crisis in her town of Guayaquil.

item.title: Samaritans: What it's like volunteering during lockdown
item.description: Volunteer Laura Bealin-Kelly says working at the charity is "the highlight of my week".

item.title: Coronavirus: Northumberland holiday home for sick children remains closed
item.description: A holiday home for families with ill children remains closed until next year due to coronavirus.

item.title: Coronavirus: Women turn street food carts into disinfection units
item.description: Dozens of women in Afghanistan who were operating solar-powered food carts have had the vehicles converted into mobile disinfection units to help tackle coronavirus.

item.title: Coronavirus: US v other countries... did it mess up its reopening?
item.description: By the time most Americans emerged from lockdown restrictions, a second surge was already under way.

item.title: Quiz of the week: Which Chicken Run star was 'plucked and stuffed'?
item.description: How closely have you been paying attention to what's been going on during the past seven days?

item.title: Live gigs are back - but social distancing poses problems
item.description: An Elton John tribute is one of the first acts to perform in front of an audience since lockdown.

item.title: Coronavirus: The slow death of the American all-you-can-eat buffet
item.description: Buffets, beloved by many Americans, are rapidly changing their business model to adapt to the virus.

item.title: Coronavirus doctor's diary: So, did the Bradford choir have Covid-19 in January?
item.description: A Bradford choir that coughed in January gets the gold standard T-cell test - and is surprised by the result.

item.title: 'My Nigerian great-grandfather sold slaves'
item.description: Colonial slave-traders are seeing their legacies reassessed, but what about the Africans who profited?

item.title: Coronavirus face masks: Why men are less likely to wear masks
item.description: Covid-19 kills more men than women, so why are they shunning protective masks the most?

item.title: 'Weddings every day of the week' in 2021
item.description: The 2021 wedding season is likely to see a huge rise in midweek weddings as couples consider their options.

item.title: Spain's monarchy shaken by Juan Carlos's hidden Swiss fortune
item.description: King Juan Carlos abdicated in 2014 but is once again in the spotlight over his financial dealings.

item.title: Coronavirus: My 86 days in hospital fighting Covid-19
item.description: Babak Khosrowshahi spent more than 12 weeks in hospital - he was determined to walk out a survivor.

item.title: Obituary: Civil rights leader John Lewis
item.description: John Lewis forged his legacy as a champion for civil rights and racial equality in the 1960s.

item.title: Coronavirus tests: Swabs don't damage the brain and other claims fact-checked
item.description: False rumours that coronavirus tests can be harmful have circulated in several different languages.

item.title: Coronavirus: Boris Johnson statement fact-checked
item.description: Reality Check examines five claims made by Prime Minister Boris Johnson and Lady Harding.

item.title: Rockfield Studios: Where Ozzy, Oasis, Queen and Coldplay took off
item.description: The studio on the Welsh-English border which has been the hangout for rock royalty for 60 years.

item.title: Norwich 0-2 Burnley: 'Naive, inexperienced, stupid' - Daniel Farke on defeat to Burnley
item.description: Norwich boss Daniel Farke says the two first-half red cards in his side's defeat by Burnley were "naive, inexperienced, stupid and not professional".

item.title: 'Lethal in attack' - watch Aubameyang's sublime FA Cup double
item.description: Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang seals the deal with two goals in 2-0 victory over Manchester City, sending Arsenal into the FA Cup final.

item.title: Verstappen and Albon exposed by trouble at Red Bull
item.description: The problems with Red Bull's car are taking their toll on both Max Verstappen and Alex Albon.

item.title: England v West Indies: Rain wipes out day three of second Test
item.description: England face a race against time to level the series against West Indies after the third day of the second Test is washed out.

item.title: Lewis Hamilton on Hungarian Grand Prix pole position
item.description: Lewis Hamilton beats team-mate Valtteri Bottas to lead a Mercedes one-two in qualifying for the Hungarian Grand Prix.

item.title: Arsenal 2-0 Manchester City: Aubameyang double sends Arsenal to FA Cup Final
item.description: Watch highlights as Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang scores twice for Arsenal in their 2-1 FA Cup semi-final win against Manchester City.

item.title: Coronavirus: What are the rules for face masks or face coverings?
item.description: England will follow Scotland by making face coverings compulsory in shops.

item.title: Coronavirus: What are the UK's travel rules and which countries can you visit?
item.description: New agreements mean people entering the UK from certain countries will not have to quarantine.

item.title: Coronavirus: What are social distancing and self-isolation rules?
item.description: Social distancing and lockdown rules are changing in England - but what can you now do?

item.title: Coronavirus UK map: How many confirmed cases are there in your area?
item.description: Key graphics explaining how coronavirus has spread in the UK and the government's response.

item.title: Coronavirus: How does the 'eat out to help out' scheme work?
item.description: Diners will get money off their bill on certain days to help kickstart the hospitality industry.

item.title: Coronavirus: What's the risk on transport?
item.description: People are being asked to return to work, meaning public transport could become more crowded.

item.title: Coronavirus: Can my boss force me to go back to work?
item.description: The advice about going back to the workplace in England will change from 1 August.

item.title: Coronavirus vaccine: When will we have one?
item.description: About 200 groups of medical researchers around the world are working on a vaccine for Covid-19.

item.title: Coronavirus: How does contact tracing work?
item.description: People who have been in close contact with someone found to have Covid-19 are now being traced.

item.title: Bowling alleys and casinos to reopen - what will they look like?
item.description: Bowling shoes could become a thing of the past says one firm, as it prepares to reopen in August.

item.title: Coronavirus: What are the rules on weddings?
item.description: Many weddings were cancelled during lockdown, while some will have to change to meet the new rules.

item.title: Coronavirus: When I can watch sport or have my eyebrows done?
item.description: As lockdown eases in England, more activities are being allowed but how are customers being kept safe?

item.title: Coronavirus: What closes in a local lockdown?
item.description: Local authorities will be given the power to take action on coronavirus outbreaks in their area.

item.title: Coronavirus: How the financial shockwave is affecting jobs and money
item.description: With the UK facing a severe economic downturn, what is the outlook for our personal finances?

item.title: Unemployment rate: How many people are out of work?
item.description: The number of people claiming benefits has surged, but the unemployment rate has barely moved. Why?

item.title: Coronavirus cure: What progress are we making on treatments?
item.description: Teams around the world are looking into medicines for Covid-19 and scientists are starting to discover what works.

item.title: Who won't have to wear face coverings in shops?
item.description: Questions about the face covering rule changes in England and other coronavirus topics.

item.title: Cardiff University student creates Welsh scientific words
item.description: Bedwyr Ab Ion Thomas is researching fatal diseases with terms which had no Welsh translation.

item.title: Coronavirus: Care home residents recreate record covers
item.description: Staff at the home came up with the idea to entertain those living there during lockdown.

item.title: Coronavirus in Scotland: Fears that economic scars will run deep
item.description: Borrowed billions are propping up the economy, but some fear the economic scars will be long-lasting.

item.title: Banksy: New coronavirus-inspired artwork appears on Tube
item.description: The enigmatic graffiti artist returns to his Underground roots for his new pandemic-inspired piece.

item.title: How to stop your glasses steaming up with a mask on
item.description: Three simple tips to stop your glasses fogging up while you shop with a mask or face covering on.
